newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends lower on importers' demand.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends lower on importers' demand.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar ended lower against the greenback on Monday as routine U.S. dollar demand emerged from importers, dealers said.
The local unit finished at T$27.495 against Saturday's close of T$27.490. Turnover was a moderate US$136 million.
"Importers' commercial demand for the U.S. dollar usually emerges on Monday. Besides that I did not notice any market-moving factors," said one dealer.
Dealers said the Taiwan dollar is likely to move in a narrow range of T$27.485-495 on Tuesday.
